intro: Galium pumilum var. majus, commonly known as the greater bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, sprawling stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Galium pumilum var. majus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and streambanks.
